section.title: Purge JMS destinations
section.para: Purging JMS destinations during the test run is quite essential. Different test cases can influence each other when sending messages to the same destination endpoints. Of course a test case should only receive messages that belong to it. Therefore it is a good idea to purge the JMS destiantions between the test cases to remove obsolete messages that are stuck in a JMS queue for some reason.

The 'de.consol.testsuite.actions.PurgeJmsQueuesBean' action offers the property "queueNames" to hold all destiantion namse that are supposed to be purged. As you can see in the next example it is quite easy to specify a group of destinations.

tip.para: Usually you do not need to execute the action by yourself in every test case. The test suite definition offers tasks to run before, between and after the test cases. This is a very simple way to purge the destinations between the tests. See for more information about this.
